Package com.j2speed.async

Interface Summary
Async An asynchronous computation that can be executed on a specified AsyncRunner.
AsyncExecutor The Executor specialisation for use in and AsyncRunner.
AsyncRun Represents the current execution life cycle of an asynchronous computation.
AsyncRunner A runner for asynchronous operations.
CompletionHandler An ExceptionHandler that also handles the notification of the completion of a computation.
ExceptionHandler Handles the exception caught during the execution of an asynchronous computation.
Progress<T> Represent the progress result notified to a ProgressHandler during the processing of a Progressive.
ProgressHandler<T> It handles the values received during the execution of an asynchronous Progressive.
Progressive<T> A request that can produce multiple instances of the specified type and we want the ability to process each one whenever it is ready.
ProgressState<T> Notifies a progress handler of a progress.
Request<T> A request that produce a value of the specified type.
ResponseHandler<T> It handles the value received as a result of the execution of an asynchronous Request .
Result<T> Represent the result notified to a ResponseHandler during the processing of a Request.
State Allows the execution of an asynchronous computation to query the running status.
 

Class Summary
AsyncCompletion A compound class that provide both the definition of the computation and the handling of its completion.
AsyncLoop<T> A loop based Progressive that executes until the execution is cancelled or the loop has no more available iterations.
AsyncProgress<T> A compound class that provide both the definition of the computation and the handling of its progress.
AsyncResponse<T> A compound class that provide both the definition of the computation and the handling of its response.
CompletionAdapter An empty implementation adapter for CompletionHandlers.
DefaultRunner An AsyncRunner that uses a bound number of maximum threads.
Edt Transfer class for the EDT.
ExceptionAdapter An empty implementation adapter for ExceptionHandlers.
ProgressAdapter<T> An adapter for the interface.
ReentrantExecutor The default implementation of the AsyncExecutor interface.
ResponseAdapter<T> An adapter for the interface
SyncRunner An "asynchronous" runner that uses the calling thread to execute the asyncs.
 

Exception Summary
CancelledException Exception thrown if the current asynchronous computation has been cancelled.
 

Annotation Types Summary
RunOn Annotation to mark a method that needs to be invoked on a specific thread (or pool of threads).
